column4: If I am able to access files on a failing disk, would I be able to copy the files to another disk without loosing data?
Depends on if the blocks are corrupted. But in principle yes.
If blocks are corrupted, would a repair attempt damage my files?
Unless spinning the disks damages it or your program just starts doing random writes. Which doesn't seem likely.
But yeah; I can't install MIT Scheme from the repos.
In disk utility, SMART status says "disk has a few bad sectors" how do I correct this?
Backup and buy a new one. It's too small to really repair.
Would dd-ing my data across to a new drive keep everything intact?
Depends on the integrity of the disk image.
If you mess it up your screwed. Also you'll probably have to resize it for the new drive.
I wanted a list of options.
ok. What is the best way to preserve everything? Sadly it's the boot disk...
